js.name: JavaScript File
js.description: A JS file is a text file containing JavaScript code that is used to execute JavaScript instructions in webpages. It may include functions that open and close windows, validate form fields, enable rollover images, or create dropdown menus.

js.name: JScript Executable Script
js.description: JS files are referenced by webpages that incorporate JavaScript functions. They are usually imported in the or sections of the HTML. JS files are helpful when the same JavaScript code is used in multiple webpages as they allow the different pages to reference the code in the one external JS file.

jsx.name: ExtendScript Script File
jsx.description: Script written in the ExtendScript language, an extension to the JavaScript language; used for writing plug-ins for Adobe Creative Suite (CS) applications; may be created using the ExtendScript Toolkit included with Adobe Utilities.

jsx.name: React JavaScript File
jsx.description: ExtendScript is a proprietary scripting language developed by Adobe that is similar to JavaScript.
